title: Can you prove you really are who you say you are? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. I went through periods in my life where I dressed to impress and put on a mask for people to see me as I wanted them too. Now I'm older, I've done some good things in life, but also some inappropriate things. I no longer regret the past, nor wish to shut the door on it. I'm a good person that will entertain a liar instead of hurting him by calling him a liar to his face. Ii help people in need when I have the ability to do so. I also judge other people only to the degree of whether I should keep company with them and I treat people with all the respect and kindness I have. Even when I have had to get people to back off by telling them not to mistake kindness for weakness. I consider myself sweethearted, but tough fisted.

What difference does it make? I could be a princess or a high priestess … or a school teacher … or a swamp alligator with a keyboard … take a guess … I’m not looking to lend/borrow money, attend your church/place of work, invite you to dinner/movie, ask to borrow your car/living room … So, if I’m Judy Hornbrook, or Judy Cornbread … ?? What difference does it make? If someone wanted to know more about me - I’m generally forthcoming … for example: I owe no $$ to anyone - so ?? Feel better yet? Hi …. I’m Judy, and you ???

“Are you really who you say you are?” No. The person I say I am - if by that you mean the persona I choose depending on my context - is not who I am. It is a social construct, either consciously or unconsciously created by me to fit my perception of the expectations of the role I am presently inhabiting. Everyone knows the popularism “teaching is an acting profession.” As a teacher, I can attest this is true - from the first lesson I taught in 1979 to today, I have been acting the role of “Nice Mr Hawkes”. Indeed, my academic website and my business cards use the initialisation NMH. However, life itself is an acting profession. Shakespeare gives us seven roles we all play. I’d say it is hundreds. Maybe thousands.

Each person or entity you have to prove yourself requires a particular credential, so the question needs to specify to whom you are proving your identity. In the end it depends in an unknown way on the discriminating power and rationality of the entity.

I would say consider our comments here. Consider the sort of responses they get. Thats about all you can do. Unless I go through the little dance with someone privately, via IM, i’m not going to hand out more identifiying info that i already have. Besides. This is a good place for a PSA. I just got a call saying my SSN was suspended. Luckily for me, Ben got the same call last week. He freaked out, going outside and calling a bunch of people. For whatever reason, he didn’t ask me. I overheard and asked him the calling number. It was on a scam list. After my call I looked up whether there’s such a thing as a suspended SSN. There isn’t. Scammers watching: eat shit mother fucker.

No, I am not really me. There has never been a time when I was myself. I was born as a single cell, now i am billions of cells. All that was once a part of me is now gone, and in it’s place there are molecules that were once part of something else. You can instead say I am more like everbody and everthing than I am like myself. There is no proof that I am myself. My DNA shortens everytime I grow. What was once my original DNA is now a part of the original DNA. My harmones are not what they used to be. I used to be able to digest milk (lactose) as a kid, now as an adult I have lost that ability. I am not who you think I am, but it does not bother me. I dont think myself as a person. I am a combination of chemical reactions. I am subjective.

Idea: We could hash our DNA and use the hashes as IDs. A hash is a relatively short number that ‘uniquely’ describes a set of data of any size. You’ll always get the same hash from the same data set. So in order to prove it you’d just let the other person sample your DNA from several random places on your body and they could hash it to get your ID number. It’d be hard to steal someone’s DNA and put it in those random spots for it to be sampled. You’d have to change the DNA of a ton of cells in your body which is hard to do and maybe is even impossible. You then connect the hash to any other data in a secured database for that specific service.

I collect experiences, own or from others I trust. Test the advice. If they fit - fine. If they don’t - fine - then you’re a step closer to your own truth.  I can’t fit a million experiences in my credential, so I use my current ones. And I don’t think anyone would like 5000 titles to read, even if I could fit them…

It depends on the situation I’m in. At home, with my family, I am completely “the real me.” I’m lively, silly, profane, irreverent, and purely honest. When I’m with anyone other than my immediate family, I’m more of what society expects of me. I choose my words and actions carefully. I live in a very conservative area and I’m sure some of my viewpoints on politics and religion would shock my neighbors. This is probably why I never get too terribly close to anyone other than my family.

Look I was riding in my sister’s car earlier today saw my own car parked in front of the house and was like “Oh wow, Beth is home.” then I panicked because I realized I’m Beth so how am I also in the house. I’m stupid…so to answer your question no I’m not sure.

I am the real Ava Farrugia. Anyone else either has the same name or is an imposter here on Quora. To be honest, i really don’t know what the “real” me is. I don’t know what my personality is and what i’m like.
You take our word for it. In site that is littered with russian troll and quora bots the real people are pretty easy to recognize.
I am who I say I am, but you’re not who you say you are because you don’t exist. All of you are figments of my imagination.
if you don’t want to believe me that’s fine. Don’t have to think that I am the person I’m saying I am but for me I think I’m being 100% honest on who I am.
The realest me is the one that knows he is an unfinished version of a self. The rest would be pretenders and/or impostors.
Look in the mirror. Are you someone else? If you are pretending, find your own reasons or lack there of.
Time and consistency. If I’m pretending to be somebody that I’m not… I’ve been doing it for a VERY long time.
I do that every morning when I look in the mirror and see the same face day after day!!!
Ofcourse, and that usually gets me in trouble eventually. I have much more few know about.
Yes, why on Earth would anyone want to fake being a loser like me. Aim higher.

What is a real “you” or, real “me”? There can be no such thing as a real self because the whole point of being a self is to be a fabrication that can cope with other selves that are also fabrications.
Yes. I am an entity that answers this question.
I am who I say I am. Are u who u say you are?
I don’t say I’m anyone, so no.
